2.text: (That lunch was a disaster…you’re just glad to be out of there.)

4.speaker: Coachman
4.text: I have been advised to take you back to the estate immediately.

5.speaker: Coachman
5.text: Your father has an important matter to discuss with you.

6.text: (You see. If the Marquess is making an announcement now, it must be about—)

7.text: (Briefly, a glimmer of fiery red hair flits in the corner of your vision, moving like embers in the wind. It drags your eyes to a singular head within the sea of people outside the palace walls.)

8.text: (It’s Esra. But…it’s strange. He looks a bit different.)

9.text: (Finally, you put a name to what’s off. He dons a thick hooded cloak draped over one of his shoulders. Strange, but not necessarily suspicious.)

10.text: (What [i]is[/i] suspicious is how he bobs and weaves, looking like he’s trying to head off somewhere without catching anyone’s attention.)

11.text: (He’s failed astoundingly, but it isn’t due to a lack of effort. Rather, his features are difficult to disguise.)

12.text: (He is a male lead from [i]Full Blossom[/i] after all. It would be impossible for a player to miss him.)

13.text: (Looking in the general direction of his dodgy gait, it seems like he’s heading towards town.)

14.text: (You’re about to start tailing him, until you hear the soft clearing of the coachman’s throat, a silent indicator that you should be hopping into the carriage rather than staring dumbly at someone who now appears to be any other servant.)

15.text: (Shit. You should follow after Esra, but you need to ditch this carriage first.)

16.options: “Gasp! My ring is gone. I’m so sorry—I must have left it inside. I’ll be right back.”|“And who are you to tell me what to do? I’ll find my own way back.”|“Gee thank you. That sounds great—I just have to stop by the washroom before we go.”|“I have other business to attend to first. I will return soon.”

17.speaker: Coachman
17.text: I am here to serve you and will wait for as long as you need me to.

18.text: (As you run back into the palace, you turn back and look at the unassuming coachmen.)

19.text: (You feel a twinge of guilt at the tough position you know you’re about to put him in.)

20.text: (...But no matter. You need to find another exit.)

22.text: (The coachman shrinks away and looks afraid, however he reaches out as you begin to walk away. Losing the lady of the house, even one who doesn’t inspire much admiration, must still seem like a bad look for a servant.)

23.text: (You feel a twinge of guilt at your harsh treatment and the stress you’ll likely cause him once you manage to shake him off.)

24.text: (...But no matter. You need to catch up to Esra.)

30.text: (A man steps in front of you so suddenly that you run right into his chest.)

31.text: (He smells of bay leaf and amber, the silk of his clothes cooling your cheek before you step back to glare up at him.)

33.text: (A man looks down at you… or, well, you [i]think[/i] he looks down at you.)

36.text: (Somehow, just from his tone, you doubt he’d believe you if you said yes.)

37.speaker: "Cecilia"
37.text: Did you need something from me? I am in a bit of a hurry, as I’m sure you could tell.

38.text: (The man smiles, reminiscent of a carny trying to entice you into a rigged game.)

39.text: Must a man need a reason to speak with a woman as pretty as you?

40.options: "Pardon me?"|"I've no time for this."|"Apologies but I don't associate with strangers in dark alleyways."

41.text: (He steps in front of you, chest to chest, and holds up one hand so that you can see the coin between his index and middle fingers. Light glints off of it and into your eyes.)

43.text: (A trickle of ice cold fear drips down your spine. Why does he keep stopping you? Who is this man?)

44.text: I’ve an idea, I think, that will give us both what we need.

45.speaker: "Cecilia"
45.text: Pardon, but I only need past [i]you[/i] at the moment. It’s a very [i]simple[/i] solution, if you would just move.

46.text: And I shall do precisely that, should you play and win a [i]simple[/i] game with me.

48.text: (Is he simply a con artist seeking an easy pick? If that’s the case, you can indulge him in a quick game and move on. Besides, he’s bigger than you, it’s not like you could force your way past anyways.)

49.speaker: "Cecilia"
49.text: …And what kind of game would that be?

50.text: A simple game of chance, of course! Nothing nefarious for a lady in full bloom.

51.text: (The coin turns over in his fingers easily, quickly, to the point your eyes almost can’t follow it.)

52.text: (Then, he closes his fist around it.)

53.text: Heads or tails, if you would?

54.text: (It seems there is a shadow of Cecilia still remaining inside you.)

55.text: (He lifts his palm, and looking up at you is the coin.)

57.text: (It seems there is a shadow of Cecilia still remaining inside you.)

58.text: (He lifts his palm, and looking up at you is the coin.)

61.text: Pity. It seems as though this is your loss.

62.speaker: "Cecilia"
62.text: You did something to the coin.

64.text: Ahhh…of course the [i]ever[/i] pragmatic Lady Cecilia Antirrhinum of House Karmina sees straight through me.

65.text: Then I suppose this is my loss.

66.text: (The man steps out into the alley, at least enough for you to finally see who he is.)

68.text: (Hermes Antirrhinum de Paparo, “The Fixer,” as some like to call him. He didn’t appear too often in [i]Full Blossom,[/i] but you do remember he was quite the skilled jack of all trades.)

69.text: (Adopted into the Paparo house due to his talent as a merchant, he earned the family quite the fortune and got most of their more…[i]unsavory[/i] jobs done. Hermes had a penchant for treating people like pieces he could bet on in a game.)

70.text: (...A game he made sure to always [i]fix[/i] in his favor.)

71.text: (His actual role in the game was negligible, acting more as a source of advice and warning to the main character should the player need any hints.)

72.text: (This was all done on the wishes of his adoptive sister, Lady Isidora, and the story never gave any focus as to his actual opinions regarding any other characters.)

73.text: (In fact, Hermes was less of a character and more just a glorified game tool.)

74.text: (A game tool that now stands between you and a suspicious love interest.)

75.speaker: Hermes
75.text: Forgive me if I am incorrect, but as far as I am aware this side of town is rarely ever graced by your noble presence. I assume you’re not familiar with the layout?

76.speaker: Hermes
76.text: As payment for you catching my scheme, I could provide you with a tour of the area, my lady.

77.text: (It’s almost impossible to read what he’s thinking, but you’re willing to bet he’s well aware of Cecilia’s reputation and wants to make a business connection.)

78.text: (It’s unlikely for Cecilia to ever roam around town on her own, so he must be seizing this opportunity while he has it.)

79.options: I need to keep following Esra.|Building a connection with Hermes now will be useful.

80.speaker: "Cecilia"
80.text: If you have something to discuss with me, schedule a meeting.

81.text: (Sorry Hermes, but Esra is more important right now.)

82.text: (Hopefully this doesn’t mar any relations with him in the future. You’d prefer to know your bridges before you burn them.)

83.speaker: Hermes
83.text: Hmm~ Lady Karmina, your sharp tongue goes not a day without drawing blood.

84.speaker: Hermes
84.text: Of course, I’d expect nothing less from you.

85.speaker: Hermes
85.text: But, I see. Far from it for me to stand between someone and their business matters.

86.text: (The lie is so obvious, it plays out more as an attempt at a joke…one bordering on being a threat.)

87.text: (As usual, his face gives nothing away, always kept blank and smiling.)

88.text: (It’s like an uncanny mask. So uncanny that if someone were to tear away at his skin, you’d expect to see more flesh rather than muscle and blood and bone.)

89.speaker: Hermes
89.text: Pity. Perhaps we may become more acquainted in the future.

90.speaker: Hermes
90.text: Feel free to stop by my business whenever you’re available, it’s just down this alley.

91.speaker: Hermes
91.text: Not quite the ideal location for some, but I promise it’s well worth the trouble.

93.speaker: Hermes
93.text: Your words are as sweet as music to my ears.

94.speaker: Hermes
94.text: I look forward to seeing you soon, my lady.

95.text: (With a light bow, he backs away, fading into the crowd without a trace.)

96.text: (No time to linger though. You can’t lose track of Esra.)

97.text: (Trying to avoid any unnecessary eye contact and recognition, you duck and dodge between passersby, straining to catch up to where you saw Esra heading last. Finally, you manage to catch sight of him again…)

98.text: (…Right as he ducks into another doorway.)

100.text: (It’s small, barely enough to fit ten people. Even worse, a loud set of chimes set atop the door announces his arrival. You won’t be able to follow him inside without being clocked immediately.)

101.text: (Standing around at the front seems a bit too obvious. Luckily though, you manage to spot a small slanted window to the side.)

102.text: (If you sneak around the building, maybe you can find a window to peek through.)

103.speaker: Shopkeeper
103.text: -ternoon Sir. ‘Sere anything I can help you with today?

105.text: (Well at the very least, you can still eavesdrop on their conversation.)

106.speaker: Esra
106.text: I’d like to meet with the boss. I have an appointment.

107.speaker: Shopkeeper
107.text: Yes, yes! Of course Sir. Give me a minute. I’ll go tell the boss you’re here.

108.text: (Well he’s obviously not here for a juicy, new read. What’s he doing in there?)

109.text: (No way around it, this whole thing is shady. [i]Full Blossom[/i] never mentioned Esra doing anything like this.)

111.text: (A deep, raspy laughter erupts. Must be the boss.)

112.text: Heard there was some posh, fancy-pants noble looking for me.

113.text: Heard he dropped some pretty coin too.

115.speaker: Esra
115.text: I have many sources, the better question is how haven’t I learned about you sooner?

116.speaker: Esra
116.text: So this is the man behind the legend…

119.speaker: Esra
119.text: Oh I hear a [i]lot[/i] of things.

120.speaker: Esra
120.text: I hear that you’re selling fraudulent goods. I also hear that you’ve been underreporting your sales on your tax forms.

121.speaker: Esra
121.text: I’ve even heard that you’re blackmailing every other business on the street into paying a “protection” fee to you…

122.speaker: Esra
122.text: [i]Tsk.[/i] You merchant types are all the same.

123.speaker: Esra
123.text: You always put on a smile and pretend to be just an ordinary citizen.

124.speaker: Esra
124.text: In reality, you’re a blight on our kingdom. You’d do anything for just a bit more wealth, no matter the consequences it creates for those you abuse.

126.speaker: Hugo
126.text: Who are ya, ya bastard!? What d’you want from me!?

127.speaker: Esra
127.text: Oh, forgive my manners. I forgot to introduce myself.

128.speaker: Esra
128.text: My name is Esra Rosas de Durazno. I work for the royal family…

131.text: (You should get out of here before they discover you. With her business reputation, Esra might think that Cecilia is working with the shopkeeper and have you arrested as well.)

132.text: (Even if he didn’t, you can’t be sure he wouldn’t just play dumb and arrest you either way.)

133.text: (It took a few hours, but you finally made it back to the de Karmina estate without getting spotted by any royal guards.)

134.text: (You need to be more cautious in the future. Just because you’re familiar with the game doesn’t mean you know every detail.)

136.text: (You knew he had a strong sense of justice, but watching him take action in person is completely different from reading his dialogue off a screen.)

137.text: (It’ll be interesting to see what else [i]Full Blossom[/i] didn’t mention about him.)

138.text: (They have so much influence on both the story and the world. Knowing their relationship with Cecilia, one careless mistake could spell the end of you.)

140.text: (For now, you can’t wait to bring this day to an end. It’s exhausting being the villainess.)

141.text: (...Maybe you’ll just sneak back into Cecilia’s room and call it a night. Surely the Marquess and Maverick ate supper without you, it’s already pretty late.)

142.text: (If he wants to use you, you should also make use of him. Establishing a positive relationship with Hermes will be essential for your survival as the villainess.)

143.text: (This all boils down to a numbers game and whatever Esra is doing couldn't be more important than the opportunity in front of you.)

144.text: (The most powerful network in [i]Full Blossom[/i] basically just fell right into your hands.)

146.text: (Hermes raises an eyebrow, before breaking out into a sly smirk.)

147.speaker: Hermes
147.text: Wonderful. Let us get this tour underway.

148.text: (Hermes springs immediately into action. You expect nothing less from “The Fixer.”)

149.speaker: Hermes
149.text: Lucky for you, there is no better place to start than this very alleyway.

150.text: (You follow Hermes into the plain alley. It looks unremarkable in every way.)

151.text: (It doesn’t seem particularly unsafe, but it doesn’t seem interesting either.)

152.text: (However, you know better than to underestimate him.)

153.speaker: Hermes
153.text: Now, Lady Karmina, let me formally welcome you to the location of my shop.

154.speaker: Hermes
154.text: It might not look like much, but here you can buy any number of things for a great price.

155.speaker: Hermes
155.text: Anything you find on the marketplace, I’m selling for cheaper.

156.speaker: Hermes
156.text: Even if I don’t stock an [i]elusive[/i] product that catches your fancy, I guarantee I can find it.

157.text: (He’s trying to see if Cecilia is interested in any underground goods in this city. It’s not surprising given how much of it he controls.)

158.speaker: Hermes
158.text: Of course that’s typically a service we only provide to VIP customers.

159.speaker: Hermes
159.text: But you, Lady Cecilia, are a step above even them.

160.speaker: Hermes
160.text: You could ask for anything and I’d be able to provide it for a [i]fair[/i] price.

161.speaker: Hermes
161.options: "Wow. That is really something. You must be a very good merchant."|"I'm impressed. You've certainly set up quite the successful business."|Remain silent.

162.text: (He quickly bounces back, flashing you a smile and letting out a small laugh.)

163.text: (However, his eyes don’t quite return to how they were originally, as if his initial confusion has transformed into curiosity.)

164.text: (It feels like Hermes is now studying your every movement, searching for previously unexpected possibilities. He seems prepared to pounce on any opportunity to make an ally out of Cecilia.)

165.speaker: Hermes
165.text: Your words are as sweet as music to my ears.

166.speaker: Hermes
166.text: Praise from someone as accomplished as you means everything to a small merchant such as myself.

167.text: (He sounds grateful, but he’s lying of course. He is probably the one person in the city with a web of influence large enough to rival Cecilia’s)

168.speaker: Hermes
168.text: Your words are as sweet as music to my ears.

169.speaker: Hermes
169.text: Praise from someone as accomplished as you means everything to a small merchant such as myself.

170.text: (He sounds grateful, but he’s lying of course. He is probably the one person in the city with a web of influence large enough to rival Cecilia’s)

171.speaker: Hermes
171.text: I know it doesn’t look too impressive, but I do promise my clients only the highest quality results.

173.text: (Hermes’s smile seems to brighten somewhat, although you’re pretty sure it isn’t genuine.)

174.speaker: Hermes
174.text: While I would love to spend more time talking about my shop, we should proceed with this tour.

175.speaker: Hermes
175.text: If you would follow me, Lady Karmina.

check_es_1.text: (So many things about this world aren’t adding up to what you remembered it to be. The people are different, and the circumstances have changed.)

butthis.text: (But this is still a game, [i]right?[/i] Could this be a chance at getting affection points with Esra?)

maybetrailing.text: (Maybe trailing after Esra can help you get a better clue as to what’s going on.)

resume1.text: (And he is a love interest after all. Whatever he does has to have [i]some[/i] importance.)

fake_hermes.text: (You make a move to step around him only to be thwarted once more.)

heads.text: (The man catches the coin mid-air and something doesn’t feel right. Your instincts are screaming that this man is doing something suspicious.)

tails.text: (The man catches the coin mid-air and something doesn’t feel right. Your instincts are screaming that this man is doing something suspicious.)

return_loss.text: [i](Damnit. You don’t have time for this.)[/i]

esra_connect.speaker: "Cecilia"
esra_connect.text: Yes well, you assume wrong. I am attending to other business currently; business that you have no need to involve yourself with.

path_esra.text: (But still, it was great seeing Esra in action.)

path_not.text: (You’ll have to be especially careful around Esra and the other male leads.)

path_rejoin.text: (But that’s a topic for a different day.)

hermes_connect.speaker: "Cecilia"
hermes_connect.text: A tour would be appreciated. Thank you for your generosity.

wow.text: (Hermes breaks face for a short moment, a flit of a second at most. It appears even he can’t help but give this persona a weird look.)

impressed.text: (He flashes you a smile and lets out a small laugh.)

prompt_rejoin.speaker: Hermes
prompt_rejoin.text: If you ever need to purchase anything, I hope you’ll come to me first.
